Detailed Description

Implements commands to run the md2 diffractometer attached to a PMAC controled by postgresql.

Date:
2012
Author:
Keith Brister All Rights Reserved

Definition in file md2cmds.c.

Function Documentation

char* logtime (  ) 

Return a time string for loggin Time is from the first call to this funciton.

Definition at line 30 of file md2cmds.c.

00030                 {
00031   static char rtn[128];
00032   static char tmp[64];
00033   static int first_time = 1;
00034   static struct timeval base;
00035   struct timeval now;
00036   struct tm nows;
00037   double diffs;
00038 
00039   if( first_time) {
00040     first_time=0;
00041     gettimeofday( &base, NULL);
00042     strftime(tmp, sizeof(tmp)-1, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", localtime( &(base.tv_sec)));
00043     tmp[sizeof(tmp)-1]=0;
00044     snprintf( rtn, sizeof(rtn)-1, "%s.%06d", tmp, base.tv_usec);
00045     rtn[sizeof(rtn)-1]=0;
00046   } else {
00047     gettimeofday( &now, NULL);
00048     diffs =  (now.tv_sec - base.tv_sec);
00049     diffs += (now.tv_usec - base.tv_usec)/1000000.;
00050     snprintf( rtn, sizeof( rtn)-1, "%0.6f", diffs);
00051     rtn[sizeof(rtn)-1]=0;
00052   }
00053 
00054   return rtn;
00055 }

00272     }
00273 
00274     if( !lspg_nextshot.dsphi_isnull) {
00275       lspmac_moveabs_queue( phi, lspg_nextshot.dsphi);
00276     }
00277   
00278     if( !lspg_nextshot.dskappa_isnull) {
00279       lspmac_moveabs_queue( kappa, lspg_nextshot.dskappa);
00280     }
00281 
00282   
00283     //
00284     // Wait for all those motors to stop
00285     //
00286     if( center_request) {
00287       md2cmds_mvcenter_wait();
00288     }
00289 
00290     if( !lspg_nextshot.dsphi_isnull) {
00291       lspmac_moveabs_wait( phi);
00292     }
00293   
00294     if( !lspg_nextshot.dskappa_isnull) {
00295       lspmac_moveabs_wait( kappa);
00296     }
00297 
00298     //
00299     // Calculate the parameters we'll need to run the scan
00300     //
00301     p180 = lspg_nextshot.dsexp * 1000.0;
00302     p170 = omega->u2c * lspg_nextshot.sstart;
00303     //    p171 = omega->u2c * ( lspg_nextshot.sstart + lspg_nextshot.dsowidth);
00304     p171 = omega->u2c * lspg_nextshot.dsowidth;
00305     p173 = fabs(p180) < 1.e-4 ? 0.0 : omega->u2c * lspg_nextshot.dsowidth / p180;
00306     p175 = p173/omega->max_accel;
00307 
00308 
00309     //
00310     // free up access to nextshot
00311     //

00316 
00317     //
00318     // prepare the database and detector to expose
00319     // On exit we own the diffractometer lock and

00321     //

00324                            phi->position,

00333     fprintf( zzlog, "%s: finished with lspg_seq_run_prep_all\n", logtime());
00334     fflush( zzlog);
00335     //
00336     // make sure our has opened flag is down
00337     // wait for the p3001=0 command to be noticed
00338     //
00339     pthread_mutex_lock( &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00340     if( lspmac_shutter_has_opened == 1)
00341       pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_shutter_cond, &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00342     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00343 
00344     //
00345     // Start the exposure
00346     //
00347     lspmac_SockSendline( "P170=%.1f P171=%.1f P173=%.1f P174=0 P175=%.1f P176=0 P177=1 P178=0 P180=%.1f M431=1 &1B131R",
00348                          p170,      p171,     p173,            p175,                          p180);
00349 
00350 
00351     fprintf( zzlog, "%s: sent command to pmac\n", logtime());
00352     fflush( zzlog);
00353 
00354     //
00355     // wait for the shutter to open
00356     //
00357     pthread_mutex_lock( &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00358     if( lspmac_shutter_has_opened == 0)
00359       pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_shutter_cond, &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00360 
00361     fprintf( zzlog, "%s: shutter has opened\n", logtime());
00362     fflush( zzlog);
00363 
00364     //
00365     // wait for the shutter to close
00366     //
00367     if( lspmac_shutter_state == 1)
00368       pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_shutter_cond, &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00369     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lspmac_shutter_mutex);
00370 
00371     fprintf( zzlog, "%s: shutter now closed, unlocking diffractometer\n", logtime());
00372     fflush( zzlog);
00373 
00374 
00375     lspg_query_push( NULL, "SELECT px.unlock_diffractometer()");
00376 
00377     fprintf( zzlog, "%s: unlocked diffractometer\n", logtime());
00378     fflush( zzlog);
00379 
00380     lspg_query_push( NULL, "SELECT px.shots_set_state(%lld, 'Writing')", skey);
00381 
00382     //
00383     // reset shutter has opened flag
00384     //
00385     lspmac_SockSendline( "P3001=0");
00386     //
00387     // TODO:
00388     // wait for omega to stop moving then position it for the next frame
00389     //
00390 
00391 
00392     if( !lspg_nextshot.active2_isnull && lspg_nextshot.active2) {
00393       if(
00394          (fabs( lspg_nextshot.cx2 - cenx->position) > 0.1) ||
00395          (fabs( lspg_nextshot.cy2 - ceny->position) > 0.1) ||
00396          (fabs( lspg_nextshot.ax2 - alignx->position) > 0.1) ||
00397          (fabs( lspg_nextshot.ay2 - aligny->position) > 0.1) ||
00398          (fabs( lspg_nextshot.az2 - alignz->position) > 0.1)) {
00399 
00400         center_request = 1;
00401         md2cmds_mvcenter_prep();
00402         md2cmds_mvcenter_move( lspg_nextshot.cx, lspg_nextshot.cy, lspg_nextshot.ax, lspg_nextshot.ay, lspg_nextshot.az);

00405     }
00406 
00407   }
00408   fprintf( zzlog, "%s: done\n", logtime());

void md2cmds_moveAbs ( char *  cmd  ) 

Move a motor to the position requested.

Parameters:
[in] cmd The full command string to parse, ie, "moveAbs omega 180"

00061                        {
00062   char *ignore;
00063   char *ptr;
00064   char *mtr;
00065   char *pos;
00066   double fpos;
00067   char *endptr;
00068   lspmac_motor_t *mp;

00070 
00071   // Parse the command string
00072   //
00073   ignore = strtok_r( cmd, " ", &ptr);
00074   if( ignore == NULL) {
00075     //
00076     // Should generate error message
00077     // about blank command
00078     //
00079     return;
00080   }
00081 
00082   // The first string should be "moveAbs" cause that's how we got here.
00083   // Toss it.
00084   
00085   mtr = strtok_r( NULL, " ", &ptr);
00086   if( mtr == NULL) {
00087     //
00088     // Should generate error message
00089     // about missing motor name
00090     //
00091     return;
00092   }
00093 
00094   pos = strtok_r( NULL, " ", &ptr);
00095   if( pos == NULL) {
00096     //
00097     // Should generate error message
00098     // about missing position
00099     //
00100     return;
00101   }
00102 
00103   fpos = strtod( pos, &endptr);
00104   if( pos == endptr) {
00105     //
00106     // Should generate error message 
00107     // about bad double conversion
00108     //
00109     return;
00110   }
00111   
00112   mp = NULL;
00113   for( i=0; i<lspmac_nmotors; i++) {
00114     if( strcmp( lspmac_motors[i].name, mtr) == 0) {
00115       mp = &(lspmac_motors[i]);
00116       break;
00117     }
00118   }
00119 
00120 
00121   if( mp != NULL && mp->moveAbs != NULL) {
00122     wprintw( term_output, "Moving %s to %f\n", mtr, fpos);
00123     wnoutrefresh( term_output);
00124     mp->moveAbs( mp, fpos);
00125   }
00126 
00127 }

double  cy,

)

Move the centering and alignment tables.

Parameters:
[in] cx Requested Centering Table X
[in] cy Requested Centering Table Y
[in] ax Requested Alignment Table X
[in] ay Requested Alignment Table Y
[in] az Requested Alignment Table Z

Definition at line 173 of file md2cmds.c.

00179                              {
00180   //
00181   // centering stage is coordinate system 2
00182   // alignment stage is coordinate system 3
00183   //
00184   
00185   double cx_cts, cy_cts, ax_cts, ay_cts, az_cts;
00186 
00187   cx_cts = cenx->u2c   * cx;
00188   cy_cts = ceny->u2c   * cy;
00189   ax_cts = alignx->u2c * ax;
00190   ay_cts = aligny->u2c * ay;
00191   az_cts = alignz->u2c * az;
00192 
00193   lspmac_SockSendline( "M7075=(M7075 | 2) &2 Q100=2 Q20=%.1f Q21=%.1f B150R", cx_cts, cy_cts);
00194   lspmac_SockSendline( "M7075=(M7075 | 4) &3 Q100=4 Q30=%.1f Q31=%.1f Q32=%.1f B160R", ax_cts, ay_cts, az_cts);
00195   
00196 }

void md2cmds_mvcenter_prep (  ) 

Sets up a centering table and alignment table move Ensures that when we issue the move command that we can detect that the move happened.

Definition at line 134 of file md2cmds.c.

00134                              {
00135   //
00136   // Clears the motion flags for coordinate systems 2 and 3
00137   // Then sets them.
00138   // Each time we wait until we've read back
00139   // the changed values
00140   //
00141   // This guarantees that when we are waiting for motion to stop that it did, in fact, start
00142   //
00143 
00144   //
00145   // Clear the centering and alignment stage flags
00146   //
00147   lspmac_SockSendline( "M7075=(M7075 | 6) ^ 6");
00148 
00149   //
00150   // Make sure it propagates
00151   //
00152   pthread_mutex_lock( &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00153   while( lspmac_moving_flags & 6)
00154     pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_moving_cond, &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00155   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00156 
00157   //
00158   // Set the centering and alignment stage flags
00159   //
00160   lspmac_SockSendline( "M7075=(M7075 | 6)");
00161 
00162   //
00163   // Make sure it propagates
00164   //
00165   pthread_mutex_lock( &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00166   while( (lspmac_moving_flags & 6) == 0)
00167     pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_moving_cond, &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00168   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00169 }

void md2cmds_mvcenter_wait (  )

00200                              {
00201   //
00202   // Just wait until the motion flags are lowered
00203   //
00204

00206   while( lspmac_moving_flags & 6)
00207     pthread_cond_wait( &lspmac_moving_cond, &lspmac_moving_mutex);
00208   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lspmac_moving_mutex);

Our worker thread.

Definition at line 429 of file md2cmds.c.

00431                        {
00432 
00433   pthread_mutex_lock( &md2cmds_mutex);
00434 
00435   while( 1) {
00436     //
00437     // wait for someone to give us a command (and tell us they did so)
00438     //
00439     while( md2cmds_cmd[0] == 0)
00440       pthread_cond_wait( &md2cmds_cond, &md2cmds_mutex);
00441 
00442     if( strcmp( md2cmds_cmd, "transfer") == 0) {
00443       md2cmds_transfer();
00444     } else if( strcmp( md2cmds_cmd, "collect") == 0) {
00445       md2cmds_collect();
00446     } else if( strcmp( md2cmds_cmd, "rotate") == 0) {
00447       md2cmds_rotate();
00448     } else if( strcmp( md2cmds_cmd, "center") == 0) {
00449       md2cmds_center();
00450     } else if( strncmp( md2cmds_cmd, "moveAbs", 7) == 0) {
00451       md2cmds_moveAbs( md2cmds_cmd);
00452     }
00453 
00454     md2cmds_cmd[0] = 0;
00455   }
00456 }
